module.name: Mespelare VSCP Module
module.description: With this VSCP module it is possible to read 7 buttons, control 14 outputs and read/write IÂ²C and 1-wire buses.

reg.name: PWM test register (TEST_PWM_OUT1)
reg.description: This register holds a PWM value in tens of percents (0 - 10 for 0 to 100%).

reg.name: Zone
reg.description: File:mesp11.xml iteration 01\nZone this module belongs to (EEPROM_ZONE)

reg.name: Subzone
reg.description: Subzone this module belongs to (EEPROM_SUBZONE)

reg.name: Output 1 status register (REG_STATUS_OUT)
reg.description: Writing a value to the output control register will activate/deactivate the output.\n 0 - The output is inactivated.\n 1 - The output is activated.

item.name: Off
item.description: Output 1 is in its off state or if written set in is off state.

item.name: On
item.description: Output 1 is in its on state or if written set in is on state.

item.name: On
item.description: Output 2 is in its on state or if written set in is on state.

reg.name: Output 1 control register REG_CONTROL_OUT
reg.description:
The relay control bits enable/disable intelligent relay functionality:
 Bit 0 - Reserved.
 Bit 1 - If set: Alarm sent when protection timer triggers.
 Bit 2 - Protection timer enable.
 Bit 3 - Send On event when relay goes to active state.
 Bit 4 - Send Off event when relay goes to inactive state.
 Bit 5 - Send Started event when relay goes to active state.
 Bit 6 - Send Stopped event when relay goes to active state.
 Bit 7 - If set to one the relay is enabled.

bit.name: Reserved
bit.description: This bit is reserved

bit.name: Protection alarm
bit.description: If set: Alarm sent when protection timer triggers.

bit.name: Protection timer enable
bit.description: If set: Protection timer is enabled and will deactivate relay channel when the timer times out.

bit.name: On event on activate enable
bit.description: If set: An on event will be sent when the relay is turned on.

bit.name: Off event on deactivate enable
bit.description: If set: An off event will be sent when the relay is turned off.

bit.name: Started event on activate enable
bit.description: If set: A started event will be sent when the relay is turned on.

bit.name: Stopped event on deactivate enable
bit.description: If set: A stopped event will be sent when the relay is turned off.

bit.name: Enable relay
bit.description: Set this bit to make the relay controllable.

reg.name: Subzone for output 1 (REG_SUBZONE_OUT)
reg.description: This is a subzone related to this specific relay. If zero the the module Zone/subzone will be used else the modules zone and the relays sub zone will be used.

reg.description: This is a subzone related to this specific relay. If zero the the module Zone/subzone will be used else the modules zone and the relays sub zone will be used.

reg.name: Control byte for INP1 (REG_CONTROL_INP)
reg.description:
The control bits enable/disable input associated functionality:
 Bit 0 - Send event at raising edge
 Bit 1 - Send repeated events when input active
 Bit 2 - Send event at falling edge

reg.name: Control byte for INP2 (REG_CONTROL_INP)
reg.description:
The control bits enable/disable input associated functionality:
 Bit 0 - Send event at raising edge
 Bit 1 - Send repeated events when input active
 Bit 2 - Send event at falling edge

reg.name: Relay protection time register for relay 1 (REG_PTIME_OUT)
reg.description: This is the relay protection time. A relay will be inactivated if not written to before this time has elapsed.\n Set to zero to disable (default). The max time is 65535 seconds which is about 18 hours.\n The registers can be as an example be used as a security feature to ensure that an output is deactivated after a preset time even if the controlling device failed to deactivate the relay.

reg.description: This is the relay protection time. A relay will be inactivated if not written to before this time has elapsed.\n Set to zero to disable (default). reg.name: PWM1 status (REG_STATUS_PWM)
reg.description: Writing a value to the output control register will activate/deactivate the output.\n 0 - The output is inactivated.\n 1 - The output is activated.

item.name: Off
item.description: PWM output is in its off state or if written set in is off state.

item.name: On
item.description: PWM output is in its on state or if written set in is on state.

reg.name: PWM2 status (REG_STATUS_PWM)
reg.description: Writing a value to the output control register will activate/deactivate the output.\n 0 - The output is inactivated.\n 1 - The output is activated.

item.name: Off
item.description: PWM output is in its off state or if written set in is off state.

item.name: On
item.description: PWM output is in its on state or if written set in is on state.

reg.name: Control byte for PWM1 (REG_CONTROL_PWM)
reg.description:
The control bits enable/disable PWM associated functionality:
 Bit 0 - Reserved.
 Bit 1 - Reserved
 Bit 2 - Protection timer enable for associated output.
 Bit 3 - Send On event when PWM goes to active state (above treshold).
 Bit 4 - Send Off event when PWM goes to inactive state (below treshold).
 Bit 5 - Reserved.
 Bit 6 - Reserved.
 Bit 7 - If set to one the PWM is enabled.

reg.name: Control byte for PWM2 (REG_CONTROL_PWM)
reg.description:
The control bits enable/disable PWM associated functionality:
 Bit 0 - Reserved.
 Bit 1 - Reserved
 Bit 2 - Protection timer enable for associated output.
 Bit 3 - Send On event when PWM goes to active state (above treshold).
 Bit 4 - Send Off event when PWM goes to inactive state (below treshold).
 Bit 5 - Reserved.
 Bit 6 - Reserved.
 Bit 7 - If set to one the PWM is enabled.

reg.name: Output associated with PWM1 (REG_ASSOUT_PWM)
reg.description: Output will go active if PWM > treshold.

reg.name: Output associated with PWM2 (REG_ASSOUT_PWM)
reg.description: Output will go active if PWM > treshold.

reg.name: Treshold PWM1 (REG_TRESH_PWM)
reg.description: Above this PWM value the associated output will go active.

reg.name: Treshold PWM2 (REG_TRESH_PWM)
reg.description: Above this PWM value the associated output will go active.

reg.name: Mode OUT3 (REG_MODE_OUT3)
reg.description: Operation mode of OUT. 0x01 = output, 0x02 = PWM, 0x03=SoundPlay

reg.name: Mode OUT4 (REG_MODE_OUT3)
reg.description: Operation mode of OUT. 0x01 = output, 0x02 = PWM, 0x03=SoundPlay

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Oaddr
reg.description: Row 1 of decision matrix. Originating address. Set to nickname for node that should trigger action. Oaddr is the originating address. We are only interested in messages from the node given here. 0Ã00 is segment controller and 0xff is a node without a nickname. If bit 6 of flags is set oaddr will not be checked and events from all nodes will be accepted.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: flags
reg.description: Row 1 of decision matrix. Flags. Set selection behaviour.\n The enable bit can be used to disable a decision matrix row while it is edited.\n The zone and use subzone bits can be activated to have a check on the zone/subzone information of an event. That is the zone/subzone of the machine must match the one of the event to trigger the DM row.

bit.name: Class filter bit 8
bit.description: Defines the ninth bit of the class filter.

bit.name: Class mask bit 8
bit.description: Defines the ninth bit of the class mask.

bit.name: Reserved bit
bit.description: This bit is not used.

bit.name: Subzone match
bit.description: If set to one subzone should be matched to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Zone match
bit.description: If set to one zone should be matched to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Hardcoded
bit.description: If set to one the originating address should be hardcoded to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Check Originating address
bit.description: If set to one the originating address should be checked and match to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Enable
bit.description: Enable (1) or disable (0)the decision matrix row.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Class mask (low eight bits)
reg.description: The lowest eight bits of the class mask that defines the events that should trigger the action of this decision matrix row.\n Bit 8 of the class mask is stored in bit 1 of the flag byte.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Class filter (low eight bits)
reg.description: The lowest eight bits of the class filter that defines the events that should trigger the action of this decision matrix row.\n Bit 8 of the class filter is stored in bit 1 of the flag byte.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Type mask
reg.description: Type mask that defines the events that should trigger the action of this decision matrix row.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Type filter
reg.description: Type filter that defines the events that should trigger the action of this decision matrix row.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Action
reg.description: This is the action or operation that should be performed if the filtering is satisfied. Only action code 0Ã00 is predefined and means No-Operation. All other codes are application specific and typical application defined codes could do measurement, send predefined event etc.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 1: Action parameter
reg.description: A numeric action parameter can be set and its meaning is application specific.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 2: Oaddr
reg.description: Row 2 of decision matrix. Originating address. Set to nickname for node that should trigger action. Oaddr is the originating address. We are only interested in messages from the node given here. 0Ã00 is segment controller and 0xff is a node without a nickname. If bit 6 of flags is set oaddr will not be checked and events from all nodes will be accepted.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 2: flags
reg.description: Row 2 of decision matrix. Flags. Set selection behaviour.\n The enable bit can be used to disable a decision matrix row while it is edited.\n The zone and use subzone bits can be activated to have a check on the zone/subzone information of an event. That is the zone/subzone of the machine must match the one of the event to trigger the DM row.

bit.name: Class filter bit 8
bit.description: Defines the ninth bit of the class filter.

bit.name: Class mask bit 8
bit.description: Defines the ninth bit of the class mask.

bit.name: Reserved bit
bit.description: This bit is not used.

bit.description: If set to one subzone should be matched to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Zone match
bit.description: If set to one zone should be matched to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Hardcoded
bit.description: If set to one the originating address should be hardcoded to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Check Originating address
bit.description: If set to one the originating address should be checked and match to trigger DM entry action.

bit.name: Enable
bit.description: Enable (1) or disable (0)the decision matrix row.

reg.description: This is the action or operation that should be performed if the filtering is satisfied. Only action code 0Ã00 is predefined and means No-Operation. All other codes are application specific and typical application defined codes could do measurement, send predefined event etc.

reg.name: Decision matrix row 2: Action parameter
reg.description: A numeric action parameter can be set and its meaning is application specific.

reg.description: row 3 of decision matrix. Originating address. Set to nickname for node that should trigger action. Oaddr is the originating address. action.name: Activate output(s)
action.description: Activate output(s) given by argument. The argument is a bit array where bit 0 is output 1 and so on.\n Byte 1 is Zone and byte 2 is zone page and must be equal to register content to trigger action.

param.name: Bitarry for output
param.description: A bitarray where the first bit represents output one and so on.

bit.name: output 1
bit.description: Set to one to select output 1

bit.name: output 1
bit.description: Set to one to select output 2

bit.name: output 2
bit.description: Set to one to select output 3

bit.name: output 3
bit.description: Set to one to select output 4

bit.name: output 4
bit.description: Set to one to select output 5

bit.name: output 5
bit.description: Set to one to select output 6

bit.name: output 6
bit.description: Set to one to select PWM output

bit.name: output 7
bit.description: Set to one to select 1-wire output

action.name: Deactivate output(s)
action.description: Deactivate output(s) given by argument. The argument is a bit array where bit 0 is output 1 and so on.\n Byte 1 is Zone and byte 2 is zone page and must be equal to register content to trigger action.

param.name: Bitarry for output
param.description: A bitarray where the first bit represents output one and so on.

bit.name: output 1
bit.description: Set to one to select output 1

bit.name: output 1
bit.description: Set to one to select output 2

bit.name: output 2
bit.description: Set to one to select output 3

bit.name: output 3
bit.description: Set to one to select output 4

bit.name: output 4
bit.description: Set to one to select output 5

bit.name: output 5
bit.description: Set to one to select output 6

bit.name: output 6
bit.description: Set to one to select PWM output

bit.name: output 7
bit.description: Set to one to select 1-wire output

action.name: Pulse output(s)
action.description: Pulse output(s) given by argument. The argument is a bit array where bit 0 is output 1 and so on.\n Byte 1 is Zone and byte 2 is zone page and must be equal to register content to trigger action.

param.name: Bitarry for output
param.description: A bitarray where the first bit represents output one and so on.

bit.name: output 1
bit.description: Set to one to select output 1

bit.name: output 1
bit.description: Set to one to select output 1

bit.name: output 2
bit.description: Set to one to select output 2

bit.name: output 3
bit.description: Set to one to select output 3

bit.name: output 4
bit.description: Set to one to select output 4

bit.name: output 5
bit.description: Set to one to select output 5

bit.name: output 6
bit.description: Set to one to select output 6

bit.name: output 7
bit.description: Set to one to select output 7

action.name: Toggle relay(s)
action.description: Toggle relay(s) given by argument. The argument is a bit array where bit 0 is relay 1 and so on.\n Byte 1 is Zone and byte 2 is zone page and must be equal to register content to trigger action.

param.name: Bitarry for relay
param.description: A bitarray where the first bit represents relay one and so on.

bit.name: Relay 1
bit.description: Set to one to select relay 1

bit.name: Relay 1
bit.description: Set to one to select relay 1

bit.name: Relay 2
bit.description: Set to one to select relay 2

bit.name: Relay 3
bit.description: Set to one to select relay 3

bit.name: Relay 4
bit.description: Set to one to select relay 4

bit.name: Relay 5
bit.description: Set to one to select relay 5

bit.name: Relay 6
bit.description: Set to one to select relay 6

bit.name: Relay 7
bit.description: Set to one to select relay 7

event.name: On Event
event.description: A output has been set in its ON position.

data.name: Index
data.description: Set to n indicating output n+1

data.name: Zone
data.description: Set to the zone for the module.

data.name: Subzone
data.description: Set to the subzone for the output or if it is zero to the subzone for the module.

event.name: Off Event
event.description: A output has been set in its OFF position.

data.name: Index
data.description: Set to n indicating output n+1

data.name: Zone
data.description: Set to the zone for the module.

data.name: Subzone
data.description: Set to the subzone for the output or if it is zero to the subzone for the module.

event.name: Started Event
event.description: A output has been set in its ON position.

data.name: Index
data.description: Set to n indicating output n+1

data.name: Zone
data.description: Set to the zone for the module.

data.name: Subzone
data.description: Set to the subzone for the output or if it is zero to the subzone for the module.

event.name: Stopped Event
event.description: A output has been set in its ON position.

data.name: Index
data.description: Set to n indicating output n+1

data.name: Zone
data.description: Set to the zone for the module.

data.name: Subzone
data.description: Set to the subzone for the output or if it is zero to the subzone for the module.
